title: Cardioprotective Activity of Oroxylin-A in Doxorubicin-induced Myocardial Toxicity: Antioxidant and In Vitro Studies on H9c2 Cells.
abstract: Oroxylin A is primarily sourced from the roots of Scutellaria baicalensis, a medicinal plant commonly used in traditional Chinese medicine. It can also be found in other Scutellaria species. The plant's rich bioactive profile makes it a significant source of various flavonoids, including Oroxylin A.
